Issues.Title: Support destructuring assignment in *ngIf ... as ...
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/common


### Description
ES2015 allows _destructuring assignments_ such as `var {a, b} = {a: 2, b: 3}`.
In Angular templates we can currently use constructs such as 
```
<div *ngIf="thing$ | async as thing">
```
Being able to do destructuring assignment in templates would be very helpful in some circumstances. I might expect this to work:
```
<div *ngIf="thingAndOther$ | async as {thing, other}">
```
assuming `thingAndOther$` emits objects that look like `{thing: ... , other: ...}`

### Alternative
Having an `ngIf`-free way of doing local assignments in templates (see #15280) could reduce the need for this. Following IgorMinar's  comment [here](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25351#pullrequestreview-165442868), I might expect it to look like this
```
<div *ngIf="thingAndOther$ | async as thingAndOther" #[thing]="thingAndOther.thing" #[other]="thingAndOther.other" >
```
, though that is less convenient than direct destructuring assignment.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support destructuring assignment in *ngIf ... as ..." (#27555)

Issues.Title: build: update source-map-support to get rid of Node's DeprecationWarning
Issues.Body:
Removes the following when bazel runs any of our jasmine_node_tests:
```
(node:85494) [DEP0005] DeprecationWarning: Buffer() is deprecated due to security and usability issues. Please use the Buffer.alloc(), Buffer.allocUnsafe(), or Buffer.from() methods instead.
```

I was able to find the source of the warning by running the target with the following tags:

```
bazel test packages/language-service/... --test_arg=--node_options=--throw-deprecation
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update source-map-support to get rid of Node's DeprecationWarning" (#27538)

Issues.Body:

I have changed the documents so that they work with the current version of Angular and updated any erroneous information (for example, the scripts in angular.json instead of package.json. There were also a couple of missing steps, like how to generate the server.js and browser folder. Some extensions were also missing and old commands were being used (--app).

Issues.Title: Add repository.directory field to package.jsons
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [x] Other... Please describe:

This adds a `directory` field to the `repository` objects in package.json. This is a new field for monorepos specced in this npm RFC: https://github.com/npm/rfcs/blob/d39184cdedc000aa8e60b4d63878b834aa5f0ff0/accepted/0000-monorepo-subdirectory-declaration.md

It enables cross-repository go-to-definition on [Sourcegraph](https://sourcegraph.com) for angular, as Sourcegraph can resolve packages to a specific directory in the angular monorepo.
Clients that don't know this field will ignore it (as with any other arbitrary field in package.json).

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issues.Title: Adding .text() or .selectedOption or .selected.text feature to angular reactive form control drop down list to get the text instead of the value when needed
Issues.Body:
### Relevant Package

@angular/forms

### Description

Adding a new feature to reactive form controls to get the text of a selected option in drop down list instead of its value.

In vanilla javascript, we used to work with `innerText` or with jQuery using `.text()`, but in angular, the only way is by: `this.formGroup.get('control').value`. And sometimes we need the text not the value of it.

### Describe the solution you'd like
The solution would be like adding a `.text()` or `.text` to get the selected text value of a reactive form control, so it would be something like, it `<FormControl>` is a drop list normal html `<select>` or even `<mat-select>` for angular material:

`this.formGroup.get('control').selected.text`

Or

`this.formGroup.get('control').text`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Currently, we add a click event for each `<mat-option>` or `<option>` to return the text value on click.
Here is a [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-w89kwc?embed=1&file=app/app.component.ts).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Adding .text() or .selectedOption or .selected.text feature to angular reactive form control drop down list to get the text instead of the value when needed" (#27534)

Issues.Title: Change of QueryParam not detected when mutating Array
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Not sure, but the Issue is present for at least one year. This issue at first came up here #17609 ### Description When mutating an Array inside QueryParams, the change is not detected by @angular/router: ```typescript // queryParams look something like this: // { // 'one': '1', // 'two': ['1', '2', '3'] // } const nextQueryParams: Params = Object.assign( {}, this.activatedRoute.snapshot.queryParams ); nextQueryParams.two.push('b3'); this.router .navigate([], { relativeTo: this.activatedRoute, queryParams: nextQueryParams }) .then(res => { console.log('# Response from Router.navigate is (null) ==>', res); }); ``` As you can see in the provided Stackblitz the updated queryParams will not be reflected inside the URL, and no subscribers to `activatedRoute.queryParams` will be notified about the change. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/mralexandernickel/angular-queryparams-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Freproduction%2Freproduction.component.ts) ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error No error is thrown, but Router.navigate is resolving with NULL ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.0.6
Node: 9.11.2
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.6
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.6
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.6
@angular-devkit/core              7.0.6
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.0.6
@angular/cli                      7.0.6
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.6
@schematics/angular               7.0.6
@schematics/update                0.10.6
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
**Anything else relevant?** Inside my reproduction, the Router is detecting the change when the reference of the provided array inside the queryParams changed (just setting a new array to the queryParams). I am working on a application right now, where this is not true. Still trying to figure out what is different there, to provide even more information on this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change of QueryParam not detected when mutating Array" (#27533)

Issues.Title: ng test: Debug with VS Code (Unverified Breakpoint)
Issues.Body: ### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting - [ ] feature request ``` There are similar bugs logged however most of them are outdated(2017) and have been closed ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Versions ```bash > yarn ng --version ``` Angular CLI: 7.1.2 Node: 11.3.0 Yarn: 1.12.3 OS: darwin x64 (Mojave 10.14.1) Angular: 7.1.2 ### Repro steps ```bash > npx @angular/cli@7.1.2 new explorer ``` - Launch VS Code and configure tests for debugging (Refer: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-recipes/tree/master/Angular-CLI#configure-launchjson-file) - ```json { "name": "ng test", "type": "chrome", "request": "launch", "url": "http://localhost:9876/debug.html", "webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}" }, ``` - Start debugging from VS Code (opens a separate chrome window) - - Breakpoints are not hit (Unverified breakpoint) ### The log given by the failure No logs ### Desired functionality **Breakpoints should be hit inside VSCode**

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): set use-host-property-decorator to false in new apps
Issues.Body:
Inspired by [this twitter thread](https://twitter.com/aaronfrost/status/1070389114959097856), this PR changes the default setting for the `use-host-property-decorator` codelyzer rule. 

The rule gives the developer the impression that the `host` property in the `Component` decorator is deprecated, which is not the case. 

In fact, the [angular/material2](https://github.com/angular/material2) project maintained by the Angular team uses it more than 140 times throughout the project.

Personally I've spend a few hours over the years to work around this warning, refactoring `host` properties to `@HostBinding` as I thought it was deprecated. The Twitter thread above thought me it's not, which is why I think it should be disabled.

Here we can see other people [agree on this](https://twitter.com/aaronfrost/status/1070389114959097856), and have been [for a while](https://github.com/angular/angular.io/issues/1763#issuecomment-264036519).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@schematics/angular): set use-host-property-decorator to false in new apps" (#13147)

import { Rule, SchematicContext, SchematicsException, Tree } from "@angular-devkit/schematics";

export default function(): Rule {
  return (tree: Tree, context: SchematicContext) => {
    context.logger.warn("it's happening!");

    const pkgPath = "/package.json";
    const buffer = tree.read(pkgPath);
    if (buffer == null) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Could not read package.json");
    }
    const content = buffer.toString();
    const pkg = JSON.parse(content);

    if (pkg === null || typeof pkg !== "object" || Array.isArray(pkg)) {
      throw new SchematicsException("Error reading package.json");
    }

    if (!pkg.dependencies) {
      pkg.dependencies = {};
    }

    if (pkg.dependencies["@solarwinds/nav-menu-with-migration"]) {
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-perfect-scrollbar"] = `^7.0.0`;
      pkg.dependencies["ngx-device-detector"] = null;

      tree.overwrite(pkgPath, JSON.stringify(pkg, null, 2));
    }

    return tree;
  };
}

### Desired functionality/Repro/other details that might be useful
I would like to be able to follow the testing guide when using the new angular 7:
https://angular.io/guide/testing#configure-cli-for-ci-testing-in-chrome

But similar to as mentioned in now closed issue #11582 these docs on testing at angular.io still mention/instruct the public to use the `--browser option` instead of the new `--browsers`. And also the --single-run option, which I understand should now be `--watch=false`

So this instruction:
>`ng test --single-run --no-progress --browser=ChromeHeadlessCI`

Should now be:
>`ng test --watch=false --no-progress --browsers=ChromeHeadlessCI`

The next line in the docs source mentions also returns two now missing cli options in the current ng cli 7.0.7 that I'm using:
>`ng e2e --no-progress --config=protractor-ci.conf.js`

returns:
`Unknown option: '--no-progress'`
`Unknown option: '--config'`

Can you fix the docs or the CLI to be consistent. And as workaround perhaps specify alternative for the last two options of `ng test`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng test options mentioned in testing docs don't work" (#13137)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): fix #12886, import zone related flags in other file.
Issues.Body:
fix #12886.

all zone related `flags` now in `polyfills.ts`, which will not work properly, because `webpack` will put `import 'zone.js/dist/zone'` before `setting those flags`, which will make those `flags useless`.

So in this PR, I created a standalone file `zone-flags.ts` to keep the `import` in correct order.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): fix #12886, import zone related flags in other file." (#13132)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): code coverage for ng build, ng serve and ng e2e
Issues.Body:
This PR is related to #6286 and allows `--code-coverage` and `--code-coverage-exclude` options to be used with `ng build`, `ng serve` and `ng e2e`, so that it is easy to instrument the code for coverage.

When used with these commands, the `--code-coverage` switch does not automatically create a file with the report but allows the developers to access the `__coverage__` variable from Istanbul.js inside the browser to get coverage data.
That object can then be used to generate a report as described in https://istanbul.js.org/docs/advanced/coverage-object-report/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): code coverage for ng build, ng serve and ng e2e" (#13131)

Issues.Title: build: only stamp build builds in release mode

Issues.Title: feat(select): add alternate rendering strategy for improved accessibility
Issues.Body:
Currently `mat-select` has some accessibility issues, because we don't keep the options in the DOM until the select is attached, making it harder for assistive technology to pick it up. These changes add an alternate, opt-in, rendering strategy that'll keep the options inside the DOM. The rendering strategy is controlled through the `MAT_SELECT_RENDERING_STRATEGY` injection token.

In order to facilitate the new rendering strategy, these changes introduce a new kind of portal called an `InlinePortal`. It is a portal whose content is transferred from one place in the DOM to another when it is attached/detached.

Another change that was necessary for the new rendering to work was being able to pass a portal to the `CdkConnectedOverlay` directive. If no portal is passed, the directive will fall back to the current behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(select): add alternate rendering strategy for improved accessibility" (#14430)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete scrolls text to the beginning when blurred
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Text should remain as is when blurred

#### What is the current behavior?
Text gets scrolled to the beginning when blurred

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. type a long string into the autocomplete at https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/examples
2. click out of the field
3. watch as the long text gets scrolled right such that the beginning of the text is visible at the beginning of the field (rather than the end of the text being visible at the end of the field)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
At the very least there should be some API available to disable this behavior, since we use a version of an autocomplete that can complete multiple values, and so a possible case is that *many* values get autocompleted, in which case having this behavior gets very annoying if you want to e.g. copy paste in multiple values in order at the end.

Issues.Title: mat-select memory leak, DOM nodes count increase
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Including a mat-select component and opening it in a dialog should not cause memory leaks/DOM nodes increase.

#### What is the current behavior?
In Angular Material 2 and 5, if mat-select was opened in a dialog (not necessary to select anything), closing the dialog will increase DOM nodes count. 
In versions 6 and 7, the DOM nodes count will increase even it the mat-select was not opened.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Versions:
4 - https://angular-material-2-select-leak.stackblitz.io
5 - https://angular-material-5-select-leak.stackblitz.io
6 - https://angular-material-6-select-leak.stackblitz.io
7 - https://angular-material-7-select-leak.stackblitz.io
(the resulting window links, stackblitz edit links below)
1. Open the dialog by pressing the button. Open the select menu. Close the dialog.
(versions 6 & 7 do not required the select being opened, will still leak)
2. Repeat 1) a couple of times to avoid lazy loading effects.
3. Run garbage collector (F12, Memory tab, garbage can icon)
4. Memorize DOM nodes count (F12, Performance monitor)
5. Do 1), then garbage collect.
6. The DOM nodes count will increase in every such action.


Stackblitz editable links:
2 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-2-select-leak
5 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-5-select-leak
6 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-6-select-leak
7 - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-7-select-leak
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 4, 5, 6, 7; Angular Material 2, 5, 6, 7
Windows 10, Chrome 70, Typescript 3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Similar functionality can be achieved with mat-menu component. It does not produce memory leaks in all versions. 
A workaround is possible with autocomplete as well,, however in version 6 & 7 it also leaks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select memory leak, DOM nodes count increase" (#14419)

Issues.Title: Implement a stable sorting algorithm
Issues.Body:
The Javascript standards do not specify which sorting algorithm to use. Google Chrome and several other browsers are known to use Introsort, which is an [unstable](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1517793/what-is-stability-in-sorting-algorithms-and-why-is-it-important) sorting algorithm. This matters from a UX perspective in any app, because it precludes multi-level sorting. The user can't just click on two columns in order and expect the first column to still be sorted for any given value of the second, because Introsort treats equal elements as interchangeable. 

As an example of this behavior, look at the Dessert table on [the overview page](https://material.angular.io/components/sort/overview) for mat-sort. If you sort by Calories, then Protein, the four entries with 4 g protein are all still sorted by calories. But if you sort by Fat, then Protein, the four entries with 4 g protein are no longer sorted by calories. The former, in my opinion, is the expected behavior.

To solve this issue, all you would have to do is add a stable sorting algorithm, even as simple as a bottom-up merge sort, then replace calls to sort() with calls to the new, internal algorithm.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Implement a stable sorting algorithm" (#14412)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select does not respect default parent width of 180px. Spans 100% of window,  if width of form field is not explicitly set.
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Select should be 180px which is the width of the mat-infix container

#### What is the current behavior?

Select spans 100% if width of form field is not set

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
See demo page

Chrome / Edge 17
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3731879/49593231-0d87e380-f941-11e8-90a6-631cba527c38.png)

Edge 18
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3731879/49593250-17a9e200-f941-11e8-9935-cd2553dd14fc.png)



#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Material 6.4.7, 7.1.1 

IE Edge Preview and version 18. Works as intended in version 17.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This form field has not explicit with however the select element is not contained to the 180px with of the mat-form-field-infix which contains it.
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3731879/49593033-9c483080-f940-11e8-9a4a-68b3142cdbfd.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3731879/49593088-c6015780-f940-11e8-8a17-44d0cc774e59.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select does not respect default parent width of 180px. Spans 100% of window,  if width of form field is not explicitly set." (#14406)

Issues.Title: [CdkDrag] Drag start event
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Current drag and drop implementation has no drag start event.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Current drag and drop implementation makes some drag cases uncoverable through this API. For example: I want to drag element in tree and make drag preview with needed padding value right from drag start. But i can't do it.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[CdkDrag] Drag start event" (#14404)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): Safari selects text on drag
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Safari (or any browser) should not select text when starting to drag an item.

#### What is the current behavior?
When starting to drag an item in a drop list, Safari selects the text that is near to the dragged item.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
**Stackblitz:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-b6tvka
Switch the versions of cdk and material to 7.1.0 to see the previous and correct behaviour.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
* Safari 12.0.1 (but probably not only this version)
* CDK & Material 7.1.1 

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I tried it with Chrome and Firefox on macOS and the bug did not appear there, so it is probably exclusive to Safari. This bug was introduced in the 7.1.1 release. Downgrading to 7.1.0 fixes this behaviour. This can easily be verified using the stackblitz example from above.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): Safari selects text on drag" (#14403)
